intro: Bituminaria palaestina, commonly known as the Palestine bituminous plant, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense racemes, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found on rocky slopes and in sandy soils. Bituminaria palaestina is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
